result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan P. Kroha was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ryan P. Kroha is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ryan P. Kroha was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:05 a.m. Defendant Ryan P. Kroha in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek/Bennett/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
Prison-6 years
Initial Confinement - 2 years
Extended Supervision - 4 years
Credit 288 days
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program. 
Any unpaid financial obligations reduced to civil judgments.
Appeal rights given. WEDS given. Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment given.
Adj. 9:30 a.m.
- includes cover letter and revocation summary
from defendant and response from DA re jail credit
to and reply from Judge O'Melia concerning jail sentence
from defendant to Judge and reply concerning cash bond refund

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
9:58 a.m. Defendant Ryan P. Kroha in court with attorney Lindsay L Erickson. Michael Schiek, D.A. appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek speaks to agreement/counsel free to argue sentence. Plea questionnaire & waiver filed. Schiek moves to dismiss Ct. 2 in 14CF125, Ct. 1 in 14CM196 and requests forfeiture of vehicle in 14CV223. Court grants dismissals. Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1 in 14CF125. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea; waiver free & voluntary. Court finds factual basis for plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Erickson speaks to defendant's request for new attorney. Court questions defendant as to representation; defendant satisfied. Defendant's Exh. 1 (2/10/15 letter from mother) marked, offered, received. Schiek/Erickson/Kroha statement to sentencing. Court statement--orders vehicle forfeited in 14CV223; Schiek to prepare order. 

Court sentence - 14CF125
WHS
4 yrs. POP
4 1/2 mos. county jail--commence on or before 2/24/15 at 8:00 a.m. w/Huber
Court will allow up to 45 days of jail sentence to be done in inpatient treatment
36 days' credit upon revocation
CC/CV/Supervision
DNA surcharge
Ineligible Voting Rights
Appeal Rights

01:45 pm - Defendant Ryan P. Kroha in court with attorney Lindsay L. Erickson.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf125, 14cm196 and 14cv223.  Erickson states just rec'd proposal approximately two hours ago.  Has not had chance to review.  Requests adjournment.  Bail continued.  Jury trial scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ryan P. Kroha in court with attorney Lindsay L. Erickson.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:20 
Calling 14cf127 and 14cm196 - 
Schiek statement - ERickson just recently appointed - request adjournment for Erickson to go over file - Erickson request CV forfeiture 14cv223 track along with criminal cases Waives any time limts - Court allows and will take off for 10-30 at 1:30 
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery
No contact w/co-defendant Jesse Cooper - If unable to post cash may attend inpatient treatment

03:13 pm - Defendant Ryan P. Kroha in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant Ryan P. Kroha in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf125 and 14cm196.  Information for 14cf125 has not been filed.  Schiek states Information will be filed that mirrors complaint - will procced.  Raabe will enter a not guilty plea on behalf of defendant.  In 14cf125 - Raabe filed motion to amend bond.  Schiek/Raabe statement to motion.  State objects to modification.  Court continues $1,000 cash - if unable to post cash may attend inpatient treatment.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 28, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Ryan P. Kroha in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant Ryan P. Kroha in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
8:20
State calls investigator Kyle Parish/sworn/direct- witness IDs defendant /Cross by Raabe 
Court finds probable cause exists and binds over - 
Bail continued - Raabe will have bond motion filed and will be heard at arraignment date.  Arraignment scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Ryan P. Kroha in court with attorney Adam Raabe who appears telephonically.  Defendant Ryan P. Kroha in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:54
In receipt, waive reading - has not yet spoken to client - set for preliminary - 
Defendant gives statement to bail - Bail continued at this time -  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 8, 2014 at 08:15 am.

03:06 pm - Defendant Ryan P. Kroha in court, in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states contact PD office last Wednesday and was found to be eligible.  Defendant requesting modification to sig bond.  Michlig statement to motion to modify.  Court denies motion.  Court orders no contact w/A.R. on this bond.  Bail continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

01:49 pm - Defendant Ryan P. Kroha in court, via video, in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Noel Lawrence, under the student practice rule.  Intra Circuit to BR I.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 28, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
